title: The UK finally cuts ties with the European Union
description: As the clocks struck midnight marking New Year's Day in Brussels and 11 p.m. Thursday in London, the United Kingdom finally cut its ties with the European Union, almost a year after its formal departure from the 27-nation bloc.

title: NYPD releases video it says shows woman attacking Black musician's son after falsely accusing him of stealing her iPhone
description: The New York Police Department has asked for the public's help in locating a woman it says is seen in a short security video clip attacking the son of a prominent Black musician after she falsely accused the teen of taking her iPhone.

title: GOP senator slams colleagues who support election challenge
description: Sen. Ben Sasse (R-NE) wrote on Facebook that he has been urging his Republican colleagues to "reject" objecting to the certification process of the Electoral College.

title: Georgia Republican senator to quarantine just days ahead of runoff
description: Republican Sen. David Perdue of Georgia will quarantine after coming into close contact with someone who tested positive for Covid-19, his campaign announced Thursday, with just days to go before the state's runoff race for his seat.

title: Rising GOP star says he was inspired by AOC
description: CNN's Dianne Gallagher spoke to the youngest person ever elected to Congress, Rep.-elect Madison Cawthorn (R-NC), about various controversies surrounding him and what he hopes to accomplish.

title: What's happening with the latest Trump appeals to the Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court will enter a new year Friday but there's still election drama from 2020 on its plate.

title: Tom Hanks stuns audience with new look
description: Tom Hanks gave a brief look at his bare scalp during an appearance on "The Graham Norton Show." Hanks said he shaved his head for a role in an upcoming film about Elvis Presley.

title: Manchester United forward Cavani handed three-match ban over social media post
description: Manchester United forward Edinson Cavani has been handed a three-match ban and fined £100,000 ($136,594) by the English Football Association in relation to a social media post.

title: Boris Johnson's father says he'll seek French citizenship, hours before Brexit
description: Stanley Johnson, the father of British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, has said that he intends to obtain French citizenship -- his comments coming just hours before the UK's final transition out of the European Union.

title: After HIV, Ebola, Covid-19, doctors brace for 'Disease X'
Trump returns to Washington early ahead of Republican plan to disrupt certification of Biden's win
description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump headed back to Washington Thursday morning in a departure that was earlier than anticipated as some Republicans plan to delay certification of President-elect Joe Biden's election win when Congress meets next week.

title: Republican senator slams party's plans to challenge Biden's win
Ben Sasse wrote on Facebook that 'the President and his allies are playing with fire'
description:
• Trump heads to Washington early ahead of plan to disrupt certification of Biden's win
• George Conway reacts to plan to force vote
• Opinion: The real reason to worry about Hawley's objection

title: LeBron James celebrates scoring milestone on 36th birthday
description: As if there was any doubt, LeBron James celebrated his 36th birthday in style.

title: London mayor: We have a record number of Covid-19 hospitalizations
description: CNN's Hala Gorani speaks with London Mayor Sadiq Khan amid a record number of reported Covid-19 cases in the United Kingdom. London's iconic fireworks show over the River Thames is canceled this year, and much of England is now under tough stay-at-home restrictions.

title: Environmental heroes to inspire you in 2021
description: The new year is a time for resolutions, and few could be more important than choosing to do better by nature.

title: Follow the New Year around the world
description: People around the world are beginning to wave goodbye to 2020 and welcome 2021.

title: Pope Francis will not lead NYE masses due to sciatic pain
description: Pope Francis will not lead the Vatican's New Year's Eve and New Year's Day celebrations due to sciatic pain, the Vatican said in a statement on Thursday.

title: 12 celebrities who turned down a British honor
description: Twice a year, the UK publishes its honors list recognizing those who have accomplished excellence in a spectrum of pursuits, including both celebrities and non-famous faces.

title: Football's wacky ending to 2020: Dog pitch invasion, new manager greeted with clown song
description: Often referred to as the "beautiful game," football delivered a rather more wacky ending to 2020 thanks to a excitable dog in South America and a group of disgruntled fans in France greeting a new manager with a clown song.

title: Opinion: The reason you need to worry about Hawley's objection
description:
• GOP senator to delay affirming Biden's victory by forcing votes on Electoral College results
• Analysis: What this senator's Electoral College objection really means for Republicans

title: Tesco and Pizza Hut 'shamed' for not paying the UK minimum wage
description: Britain's largest supermarket chain Tesco underpaid almost 80,000 of its workers, the UK government has revealed, as it "named and shamed" dozens of companies for not paying the minimum wage.

title: Why Hawley's move could endanger Senate Republicans
description: Senators are still blocking an immediate and final vote to override President Donald Trump's veto of the National Defense Authorization Act, Republican leaders are grappling with a new problem on their hands: GOP Sen. Josh Hawley of Missouri and his planned objection to the results of a fair and free election.

title: It's time to mandate Covid-19 vaccinations for the entire Congress
description: The 117th Congress opens Sunday, and it will convene in the shadow of the death of one of its own from coronavirus. Louisiana Congressman-elect Luke Letlow, 41, died from Covid-19 complications Tuesday, just weeks after being elected to Congress.

title: US sets daily Covid-19 death record for the second day in a row
Astronaut Terry Virts shares an 'insider's guide' to life in space
description: Cutting the hair of another astronaut on the International Space Station is one of the most stressful things US Air Force Col. Terry Virts has ever done -- even above spacewalking, flying F-16s, piloting a space shuttle and enduring multiple rounds of survival training around the world.

title: 'Jeopardy!' champion Ken Jennings apologizes for insensitive tweets
description: Ken Jennings has offered an apology regarding "unartful and insensitive things" he's tweeted.

title: New Year is greeted in muted fashion as leaders warn, Covid loves a crowd
description: Many people will want to put 2020 firmly behind them. But governments around the world have pleaded with people not to see in 2021 with traditional New Year's Eve parties and street celebrations for fear of accelerating the spread of coronavirus.

title: 'Stomach-churning': Christine Romans calls out GOP hypocrisy on the deficit
description: Christine Romans criticizes President Trump and the GOP-led Senate over the mounting deficit.

title: Willie Nelson tells Anderson about smoking pot at the White House
description: Country music legend Willie Nelson and CNN's Anderson Cooper discuss Willie's friendship with former President Jimmy Carter, getting high at the White House, and what Willie misses the most during the pandemic.

title: Covid could mean the end of backpacking forever
description: Backpacking trips have been something of a rite of passage for young people for almost 70 years.

title: Lewis Hamilton knighted in UK's New Year Honours List
description: Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton capped a remarkable year on and off the track after he was awarded a knighthood in the UK's New Year's Honours List which was announced on Wednesday.

title: Indian state bans government-run Islamic schools from teaching religious scripture
description: An Indian state ruled by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has passed a law to convert all Islamic schools to regular education institutions.

title: Virtual vacation: Amazing travel photos from 2020
description: It's been a year like no other. As we began 2020, travelers had more freedom of movement than at any time in history. Air traffic had been rising for decades.

title: China approves Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine, promises free shots for all citizens
description: China has approved the country's first homegrown coronavirus vaccine, developed by state-owned pharmaceutical giant Sinopharm, promising free inoculation for all citizens.

title: Neither human rights concerns nor US disapproval could stop the EU-China investment deal
description: In a year that has seen global perceptions of China plunge, Beijing scored a major diplomatic victory Wednesday with the finalizing of a trade deal with the European Union -- in spite of criticism from the United States and outstanding concerns many in the bloc have over Beijing's worsening human rights record.

title: The first woman to direct an NBA team as head coach in a regular season game
description: Becky Hammon became the first woman to direct an NBA team as a head coach during the regular season, when she took over for San Antonio Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich when he was ejected during a game on Wednesday.

title: Trump was briefed that China sought to pay non-state actors to attack US forces in Afghanistan
description: President Donald Trump received information earlier this month that China sought to pay non-state actors to attack American forces in Afghanistan, a senior administration official said.

title: Mob attacks and sets ablaze a Hindu temple in northwestern Pakistan
description: A mob in northwestern Pakistan attacked and set ablaze a century-old Hindu temple on Wednesday, officials said, prompting condemnations from the Muslim-majority country's Hindu community.

title: 11 people missing after landslide strikes southern Norway, leaving large crater
description: Ten people were injured, one of them critically, and 11 were classified as missing after a landslide in southern Norway swept away more than a dozen buildings in the early hours of Wednesday, police said.

title: Don Lemon rolls the tape on Trump's 2020 'insane reality show'
description: CNN's Don Lemon reviews President Donald Trump's fourth year as Commander in Chief, playing videos of Trump throughout 2020.

title: Audio recording of Melania Trump shows contrast with Trump's complaints
description: First Lady Melania Trump is heard saying she has no interest in appearing in magazines in a tape secretly recorded by Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, a former senior adviser to Melania Trump.

title: Post-Brexit UK-EU trade deal becomes law on eve of deadline
description: British lawmakers voted to back the United Kingdom's post-Brexit trade deal with the European Union on Wednesday, on the eve of the December 31 deadline marking the end of the transition period.

title: 'Bunch of baloney': Amanda Carpenter calls out Josh Hawley
description: CNN political commentator Amanda Carpenter says Sen. Josh Hawley's (R-MO) motivation to say he will object when Congress counts the Electoral College votes is purely political and not a principled stance like he claims.

title: China's Sinopharm says its Covid-19 vaccine is 79% effective
description: China's state-owned pharmaceutical giant Sinopharm has announced its coronavirus vaccine is 79.34% effective. Interim analysis of Phase 3 clinical trials show the vaccine is safe and people who received two doses produced high-level antibodies, according to a statement published by Beijing Biological Products Institute Co., a Sinopharm subsidiary.

title: Biden White House to issue memo to halt or delay midnight regulations on January 20
The ball drop will finally end 2020. Here's how the tradition started.
description: Welcoming the new year in Times Square wouldn't be the same without the famous ball drop. CNN explores how the history of this eye-catching tradition.

title: These robots can boogie down better than most humans
description: The internet swoons over Boston Dynamics' robots that dance better than most of us do. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.
